works.description: A collection of two pieces that explore the intersection of fashion and technology in unexpected ways.
works.textContent: This project stems from my obsession with combining fashion and technology. The two pieces in the collection aim to showcase that often innovation is forced into fashion and generates articles of clothing that can be inconvenient to wear and provide no additional functionality. I designed and sewed the pieces myself, created 3D printed custom parts and mechanisms for the project, as well as put together all the electronic components and the code that made them function.

works.title: Collective Composite
works.description: An interactive installation that transforms individual portraits into a collective-ever changing identity through a grid system.
works.textContent: This interactive installation transforms individual portraits into a collective-ever changing identity through a grid system. Participants step on a floor switch to trigger a countdo wn sequence, after which their por trait is captured, processed, and a single random cell is extracted from a 7×7 grid (overlaid on their face using ml5 face tr acking). This cell is printed on thermal paper using a custom dithering algorithm that converts full-color images to black and white while preserving visual quality. Participants then place their printed cell fragment on the corresponding coordinate of an illuminated lightbox display, gradually building a composite community portrait over time. As new contributions accumulate, earlier portraits become partially obscured, creating a layered timeline of collective portraits that visualizes the ever changing community identity. The project challenges self-representation by blurring the lines of individual identity, creating a communal whole that evolves throughout the exhibition.

works.title: Genuary 2025
works.description: Generative art created daily for the month of January 2025.
works.textContent: Genuary 2025 is a series of 14 generative art pieces created in January 2025 as part of the annual community-driven creative coding challenge. Each work responds to a daily prompt, exploring themes of algorithmic aesthetics, mathematical beauty, and the intersection of physical and digital media.

works.title: Need For Seat
works.description: A two-player competitive arcade game housed in a custom-built cabinet that transforms the mundane act of moving a chair into an absurdist racing experience.
works.textContent: Need for Seat is a two-player competitive arcade game housed in a custom-built cabinet that transforms the mundane act of moving a chair into an absurdist racing experience. Players move four chair-leg-shaped inputs to "walk" their on-screen chair across a room to help a man in need of seat. The project merges digital game design with physical computing and furniture-scale fabrication, creating an installation that invites playful competition and incites a Need For Seat!

works.title: Snooze Wars
works.description: Snooze Wars is an app that allows people feel more connected to their friends through more vulnerable sides of themselves in a silly, no pressure way.
works.textContent: Snooze wars is an app based social media that allows small pods/ groups of users to share their sleeping habits with each other. While most sleep tracking apps on the market currently are health apps this would take on more of a social media/ community game app. Users will be able to feel connected to their friends (people in their pod) by keeping each other accountable for waking up on time.

works.title: Spoken Wardrobe
works.description: Utilizing a combination of AI technologies, this installation takes any words you speak, generates an article of clothing from it, and shows you wearing it.
works.textContent: Utilizing a combination of AI technologies, this installation takes any words you speak, generates an article of clothing from it, and shows you wearing it. As users speak, their words are converted to text, via Whisper (a browser-based speech recognition model run using Transformers.js), and appear around them in 3D space mimicking a sor t of magical incantation. These spoken wishes are then used to query a Stable Diffusion inpainting model that gene rates custom digital garments, baked on the user’s request, and overlays them onto the user ’s body; from dresses made of flames to suits of thorns and tr ee bark.
